report_title: Auto Extended Warranty Providers in the US
executive_summary: The Auto Extended Warranty Providers industry has climbed over the past five years. Industry servicers provide automobile owners warranties that extend past the warranty a car's manufacturer provides for a new vehicle. Participants in this industry include car manufacturers, car dealers and other third-party warranty providers. During the period, the industry has benefited from the average age of the vehicle fleet in the United States increasing, as consumers typically purchase auto extended warranties or vehicle service contracts after their manufacturing warranty expires. In addition, despite an increase in per capita disposable income, new car sales fell due to the negative impact of the pandemic and inflationary pressures in the latter part.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rocky Consumer Sentiment During the Pandemic Dampened Industry Demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumers that purchase a vehicle will look to acquire a warranty plan that offers protection for the vehicle up to a certain number of miles and time, with most auto manufacturers offering a three-year, 36,000 mile plan. Since vehicles are considered discretionary goods, consumers will look to acquire warranty coverage during times of economic stability and when their.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE INDUSTRY SHRUGS OFF HIGH INFLATIONARY PRESSURES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry's diversified vehicle coverage marketplace helps it service a variety of customers ranging from acquisitions of new vehicles to certified, preowned vehicles. Extended warranty packages are broadly more popular with consumers that purchase new vehicles or that drive for longer distances, with industry servicers able to leverage this demand in their warranty policies.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: UNEVEN VEHICLE SALES LIMIT THE GROWTH OF AUTO EXTENDED WARRANTY PROVIDERS' EXPANSION PROSPECTS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite aging in the broader vehicle fleet, auto extended warranty providers endured uneven trends in the number of motor vehicle registrations and new car sales, particularly during the pandemic. With vehicles enduring depreciation, it expands the need for longer-term warranty coverage, which boosts third-party extended warranty providers that could undercut auto extended warranty providers' core markets and offer consumers a less expensive alternative.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: NEW TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCEMENT TRANSFORMS THE AUTO WARRANTY INDUSTRY, AMPLIFYING COMPETITION
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As vehicles become more technologically advanced, warranties are evolving to cover these new elements, boosting the complexities involved in writing a warranty policy. This is pushing auto manufacturers and third-party providers to enhance their offerings, contributing to intensifying competition.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: REBOUNDING CAR SALES POISED TO BOOST WARRANTY DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: New car sales will rebound following the steep declines amid the pandemic and inflationary pressures will begin to ease. This will help reduce input costs and allow automakers to enhance their profitability. In turn, auto extended warranty providers will be able to generate more revenue from a core market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Improving Economic Conditions Set to Enhance Consumers' Purchasing Power
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: New car sales will offer opportunities for industry servicers to offer more extensive warranty packages, with an aging vehicle fleet creating further incentive for consumers to upgrade their vehicle.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Boost in Car Registrations Helps Maintain Warranty Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The ultimate measure of industry success is the number of physical cars in circulation across the United States, with growth in the number of motor vehicle registrations exemplifying this trend.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Acceleration of Automobile Technology Poised to Influence Warranty Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Although warranty policies will continue to be in demand for new and used vehicles, the acceleration of vehicle technology is a crucial development that may impact the rate of industry growth in the future.

industry_definition: This industry provides automobile owners with extended warranty protection. These warranty plans are offered by the manufacturer or auto dealer at the time of purchase and are typically included in the price of the vehicle. Third-party warranty providers, who sell warranty plans after the initial purchase of the vehicle, are also included in this industry.

positive_impact_factors: With older vehicles depreciating at a faster rate, consumers will be more inclined to purchase a longer-term warranty if they opt against a new vehicle purchase, further elevating demand for the industry's services.

key_trends: Providing competitive market prices boosts internal competition.
Timely customer service strengthens industry connection with customer base.
Increasing depreciation of existing vehicles heightens long-term warranty demand.
Economic stability encourages discretionary spending from consumers.
One company owns more than a 5.0% share of the marketplace.
Strong marketability improves company image in the eyes of customers.
Increasing depreciation of vehicles fuels demand for longer-term warranty coverage.
Strict regulatory oversight protects against fraudulent claims.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment generates revenue from warranty policy sales to consumers between the ages of 18 and 34. Younger consumers will be more in demand for warranty policies, particularly since they have the lowest income flexibility out of any age group and require steady protection for their vehicle.
This market segment generates revenue from warranty policy sales to consumers between the ages of 35 to 54.

This market segment generates revenue from warranty policy sales to consumers between the ages of 55 to 64. Adults within this age category have the largest disposable income availability, making them a prime customer base for the industry.

This market segment generates revenue from warranty policy sales to consumers aged 65 and over. This market comprises over one-quarter of industry revenue. Retirees are one of the most in-demand markets for the industry, since they require long-term vehicle coverage to preserve their limited disposable income.

products_and_services.product_description: This product segment generates revenue from the sales of auto warranties for customers that purchase a new vehicle.
This product segment generates revenue from the sales of auto warranties for customers that purchase or currently operate a used car.
This product segment generates revenue from the sale of auto warranties for vehicles following the sale of a vehicle.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: As the average age of automobiles and trucks registered in the United States increases, demand for auto extended warranties follows suit.
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Manufacturing warranties, which are excluded from this industry, are often purchased with a new car. An increase in the average age of the vehicle fleet will increase the likelihood consumers opt to purchase auto extended warranties, which are included in the industry. Increases in the average age of the vehicle fleet represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

business_locations.location_description: With the Southeast capturing the largest share of the domestic population, industry servicers have diverse opportunities to sell warranty policies to a spectrum of customers. In states like Florida, many customers have high demand for vehicles, with metropolitan centers serving as an accelerant for the industry's range of services.

The Western region has one of the largest driving markets in the United States, with large distances between cities enhancing demand for cars. In states like California, the industry also benefits from large metropolitan centers that have a high concentration of customers and physical vehicles, expanding the auto warranty market.

Although the Great Lakes is a more compact geographic region, the presence of large automotive companies enhances the number of registered motor vehicles that require warranty policies. In states like Illinois, a large auto market ensures a diverse customer base for industry servicers, with dense population centers further expanding demand across the region.

The Mid-Atlantic benefits from a large demand niche for cars, with an array of younger adults making up a large portion of the industry's markets. In states like New York, large population centers and sprawling suburbia expand the need for warranty coverage for consumers' vehicles.

Despite lacking a dense population, the Plains has an advantageous geography that incentivizes car ownership. In states like Missouri, many suburban areas are in high demand for vehicles, creating a lucrative market for warranty policies.

Some of the other regions that have a significantly smaller industry presence include the Southwest, the Rocky Mountains and the New England regions. These areas lack large population centers and have far less demand for vehicles due to the compact geography and physical barriers, such as mountains and deserts, that discourage individual driving.

Some of the other regions that have a significantly smaller industry presence include the Southwest, the Rocky Mountains and the New England regions. These areas lack large population centers and have far less demand for vehicles due to the compact geography and physical barriers, such as mountains and deserts, that discourage individual driving.

Some of the other regions that have a significantly smaller industry presence include the Southwest, the Rocky Mountains and the New England regions. These areas lack large population centers and have far less demand for vehicles due to the compact geography and physical barriers, such as mountains and deserts, that discourage individual driving.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Industry servicers face significant federal and state regulatory oversight. The industry's negative reputation caused several regulations to be enacted to monitor industry practices and prevent fraud.

The Service Contract Industry Council (SCIC) is responsible for developing the framework for many of the anti-scam laws. SCIC's Service Contract Model Act aims to develop a framework that clearly defines and regulates services contracts within each state.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is mature, indicating higher barriers to entry.

basis_points.basis_title: Providing competitive market prices boosts internal competition
basis_points.basis_description: Industry servicers that offer more competitive prices for their policies will have a competitive edge in the market.

basis_points.basis_title: Timely customer service strengthens industry connection with customer base
basis_points.basis_description: Servicers that provide high-quality customer service will be able to lock in more customers long-term.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Localized dealership influence encourages low market concentration
concentration_points.concentration_description: Many customers purchase vehicles at local car dealerships, creating localized demand across smaller dealerships that can capture various market niches.

concentration_points.concentration_title: High operating costs discourage large-scale expansion
concentration_points.concentration_description: Due to declining profit margins and relatively low profits, high operating costs discourage large market expansion by servicers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Expansive Warranty Coverage Expenses Fuel Exorbitant Administrative Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: All other expenses have increased and comprise over three-quarters of industry revenue. The largest expenditure for any industry servicer is administrative expenses, most of which are entailed by warranty coverage expenses.
Warranty coverage expenses focus on the capital a provider has to allocate for the repair or replacement of any automobile covered by a particular policy.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Newer vehicles accumulating more warranty coverage costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: With newer vehicles accumulating more warranty coverage costs than used vehicles, industry servicers allocate a significant amount of capital to ensure the policy covers the customer's vehicle.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Although the industry does have some capital costs. It is primarily labor intensive due to the need for qualified staff to run daily operations. The industry's dependence on salespeople to sell warranty coverage to new customers increases labor intensity.

Although the industry does have some capital costs. It is primarily labor-intensive due to the need for qualified staff to run daily operations. The industry's dependence on salespeople to sell warranty coverage to new customers increases labor intensity.

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE INDUSTRY ENDURES MODERATE REVENUE VOLATILITY DUE
volatility_points.volatility_description: TO FLUCTUATIONS IN NEW CAR SALES Since the industry sells warranty coverage for cars, any shift in production patterns will influence how volatile the industry will be.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Recent fluctuations in new car sales
volatility_points.volatility_description: Recent fluctuations in new car sales, which were primarily influenced by the economic effects of the pandemic, affected the volume of new car sales and warranty coverage purchased by consumers. In addition, higher interest rates have limited new car sales in the latter part of the period.

volatility_points.volatility_title: VOLATILE CONSUMER SENTIMENT IMPACTS INDUSTRY STABILITY
volatility_points.volatility_description: Consumers are influenced by broader economic trends when acquiring a warranty policy, with larger economic volatility influencing the rate of discretionary spending.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCEMENT IMPROVES CUSTOMER RELATIONS AND POLICY PROCESSING
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Since auto warranty policies are documents, there is little innovative merit behind the industry's product stream. Nonetheless, increased use of mobile technology and computers to process, connect and document warranty policies for customers helps improve the industry's customer service.

FAQs.question: How diversified are your product offerings compared to competitors?
FAQs.answer: Products offered by companies are essentially homogeneous, with the only diversity coming with the parameter of the warranty being provided (i.e., part being insured and for the time and mileage it is being guaranteed for).

FAQs.question: How do you emphasize the value of your company's services?
FAQs.answer: Companies emphasize their operations' trustworthiness to demonstrate the value of their services. Trustworthiness has been an issue for many companies that have failed to pay claimants due to financial distress.

FAQs.question: What international operations do you conduct and how could benefit from increasing your international reach?
FAQs.answer: International operations are minimal. Extended auto warranty providers predominantly provide US consumers with extended auto warranties.

FAQs.question: Does your company have exposure to fintech competitors? How is it affecting your strategy moving forward?
FAQs.answer: Fintech companies have struggled to gain a foothold because they are not the original car manufacturer or a part of the process of selling the car either. This limits their understanding of how to price extended auto warranties appropriately.

FAQs.question: How do you attract and maintain talent in your workforce?
FAQs.answer: Industry wages are expected to have inched downward over the past five years.

FAQs.question: How do you ensure that you stay up to date with software and technology trends?
FAQs.answer: Technological changes are usually slow. Extended warranty providers all become aware of new technology that can streamline operations at about the same time.

FAQs.question: To what extent are your processes automated and how do you plan on investing in automation over the coming years?
FAQs.answer: Companies' operations are slightly automated especially certain aspects of the sales and pricing process. Companies would further invest in any technology that would help further automate and streamline parts of their operations in order to cut costs and increase efficiency.

FAQs.question: How have the increased capital requirements under Basel III affected operations?
FAQs.answer: Basel III is expected to have little consequence on the companies' operations since they do not extend loans. However, any change regarding capital requirements for reserves needing to develop warranties could have a material effect on extended auto warranty providers.

FAQs.question: To what extent are you affected by hard and soft pricing cycles?
FAQs.answer: Extended auto warranty pricing is based on the longevity of car parts, as opposed to the nature of a person driving or exogenous events that affect pricing.

FAQs.question: How does your profit margin compare to those of your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Extended auto providers' profits vary based on the trustworthiness of the extended auto warranty provider. Manufacturers are deemed more trustworthy than third-party warranty providers, allowing them to charge more and earn higher profits.

FAQs.question: Are your services priced competitively? How can you ensure that your prices will attract more customers than other companies?
FAQs.answer: Third-party policy prices must be competitive against the manufacturer and auto dealership extended warranty products.

FAQs.question: How has your company developed a good reputation despite negative press about the industry? What can you change or adjust to better your reputation?
FAQs.answer: Due to the negative press that auto extended warranty providers have received in recent years, operators must establish an overall good reputation as an ethical business.

FAQs.question: Which industry organizations are you currently a member of? If none, which ones would be beneficial?
Do you monitor changes in per capita disposable income? How will your services be affected by fluctuations in income levels?
FAQs.answer: Rising disposable income levels will increase consumers' ability to afford extended warranties; nonetheless, high-income levels will prompt car buyers to purchase comprehensive warranty packages from the auto manufacturer or dealership, reducing demand from third-party extended auto warranty providers.

FAQs.question: How can you adapt if regulation for this industry increases? How does regulation for this industry currently affect your company?
FAQs.answer: Primarily, the most important regulation of product warranty insurance is capital adequacy requirements. Industry profitability is also affected by capital adequacy requirements.

FAQs.question: How can you take advantage when the average age of vehicle fleets rises? How has the current age of vehicle fleets affected your company?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturing warranties, excluded from this industry, are often purchased with a new car. As a result, an increase in the average age of the vehicle fleet will increase the likelihood that consumers opt to buy auto extended warranties, which are included in the industry.
